alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 2:41PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Franklin and northeastern Crawford Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 241 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Cass, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Cass... Fern... Jethro... Toney... Bidville... Barnes... Redding... Turners Bend... Watalula... Lonelm... Cravens... Paradise... This includes Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 24 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
